{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Distances\n",
    "\n",
    "For this example notebook, we'll need to install Ripser.py to create the persistence diagrams:\n",
    "```\n",
    "pip install Cython ripser\n",
    "```"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "from sklearn import datasets\n",
    "import persim\n",
    "import persim.plot\n",
    "import ripser\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "data_clean = datasets.make_circles()[0]\n",
    "data_noisy = datasets.make_circles(noise=0.1)[0]"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<matplotlib.collections.PathCollection at 0x113b0a4e0>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 4,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 432x288 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "plt.scatter(data_clean[:,0], data_clean[:,1], label=\"clean data\")\n",
    "plt.scatter(data_noisy[:,0], data_noisy[:,1], label=\"noisy data\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Generate $H_1$ diagrams for each of the data sets"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "dgm_clean = ripser.ripser(data_clean)['dgms'][1]\n",
    "dgm_noisy = ripser.ripser(data_noisy)['dgms'][1]"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 640x480 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "ripser.plot_dgms([dgm_clean, dgm_noisy] , labels=['Clean $H_1$', 'Noisy $H_1$'])"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Compute and visualize Bottleneck distance\n",
    "\n",
    "The `bottleneck` function has the option of returning the matching when the parameter `matching` is set to `True`. With the returned data, we can use the `plot.bottleneck_matching` function to visualize which persistence points contributed to the distance."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "distance_bottleneck, (matching, D) = persim.bottleneck(dgm_clean, dgm_noisy, matching=True)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 11,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 640x480 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "persim.plot.bottleneck_matching(dgm_clean, dgm_noisy, matching, D, labels=['Clean $H_1$', 'Noisy $H_1$'])"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The default option of `matching=False` will return just the distance if that is all you're interested in."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 12,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "0.24245107173919678"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 12,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "persim.bottleneck(dgm_clean, dgm_noisy)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Sliced Wasserstein distance\n",
    "\n",
    "\n",
    "Sliced Wasserstein Kernels for persistence diagrams were introduced by [Carriere et al, 2017](https://arxiv.org/abs/1706.03358) and implemented by Alice Patania."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 14,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "1.034281047579809"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 14,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "persim.sliced_wasserstein(dgm_clean, dgm_noisy)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Heat Kernel Distance\n",
    "\n",
    "We also implement the heat kernel distance"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 15,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "0.28431455128208605"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 15,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "persim.heat(dgm_clean, dgm_noisy)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The parameter `sigma` controls ..."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 17,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "(0.9452992394565936, 0.12581612617123678, 0.013535132715043233)"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 17,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "persim.heat(dgm_clean, dgm_noisy, sigma=0.1), persim.heat(dgm_clean, dgm_noisy, sigma=1), persim.heat(dgm_clean, dgm_noisy, sigma=10)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": null,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": []
  }
 ],
